name: Academic Letter Architect Rubric
description: Evaluation criteria for recommendation letter quality

criteria.name: Evidence-Based Advocacy
criteria.description: Quality of specific examples supporting claims about candidate

scores.1: No specific evidence; only generic adjectives
scores.3: Some specific examples but incomplete coverage
scores.4: Good evidence with specific achievements and outcomes
scores.5: Excellent evidence; concrete examples, quantified achievements, clear impact

criteria.name: Comparative Statements
criteria.description: Quality of comparisons providing context for candidate's abilities

scores.1: No comparative context; reader cannot calibrate claims
scores.2: Weak comparisons ('above average', 'one of our better')
scores.3: Some comparison but not specific or impactful
scores.4: Good comparisons with specific reference class and ranking
scores.5: Excellent comparisons; specific percentile/ranking with meaningful context

scores.2: Weak structure; missing opening context or closing endorsement
scores.3: Adequate structure with all sections present
scores.4: Good structure with clear opening, evidence body, strong closing
scores.5: Excellent structure; compelling opening, well-organized evidence, powerful closing

criteria.name: Tone Calibration
criteria.description: Appropriateness of enthusiasm level and language

scores.1: Tone undermines candidate (lukewarm language, damning with faint praise)
scores.4: Good enthusiastic tone appropriate for US academic context
scores.5: Excellent calibrated enthusiasm; genuine, warm, appropriately superlative

criteria.name: Audience and Context Match
criteria.description: How well content is tailored to opportunity

scores.1: Generic letter not tailored to opportunity
scores.3: Some tailoring but misses key opportunity requirements
scores.5: Excellent tailoring; content directly addresses opportunity requirements

criteria.name: Credibility Establishment
criteria.description: How well writer establishes their authority to recommend

scores.1: No context about writer's relationship or qualifications
scores.2: Vague relationship description; unclear basis for assessment
scores.3: Adequate relationship context but could be stronger
scores.4: Clear relationship, duration, and capacity for observation
scores.5: Compelling credibility; clear authority, deep knowledge of candidate

passing_note: Average score must be â‰¥ 3.5 for letter to be considered complete. Scores below 3 in 'Evidence-Based Advocacy' or 'Tone Calibration' require revision.
